block.p: Complaints, complaints everywhere -- but New York City police investigators said there was no evidence that anyone was tampering with the bottled water sold in the city.

The deluge began with three initial complaints, in which ammonia and a lye-type cleaning agent were found in three water samples. The police were leaning toward a theory that all three were accidents, in which cleaning supplies had somehow come in contact with bottles.

Dozens of complaints had been filed after the first incidents were reported, but investigators said they viewed them as the products of fear, fantasy and flimflam.
